Message.LevelTwo: This function is not yet available.

Message.LevelOne: This will reload the Remote System Explorer. Are you sure?
Message.LevelTwo: This action should only be used after receiving files from a team repository. It reloads the RSE from the workspace, incorporating the new files.
You must enter a name in the field where the cursor is positioned.
This name is already used by another resource. Enter a unique name.
The name entered does not have valid syntax
You have left the new name the same as the old name. Enter a new name that is different from the old name.

Message.LevelOne: Name %1 is specified more than once
Message.LevelTwo: Two or more resources have been renamed to the same new name. Each resource must have a unique name.
The name %1 does not have valid syntax
You have the new name entry field empty. You must enter a unique new name.

Message.LevelOne: Expand failed or canceled. Try again.
Message.LevelTwo: When expanding a node in the tree, and retrieving the resources, either an error occurred or you cancelled the operation. The expand is cancelled.

You must enter a name for the profile. Profiles contain all connections, filters and user defined actions. They are shared by the team, but each team member sees only those profiles which are active. Each profile can be private to you, or used by the whole team if all team members make the profile active. The name should reflect this. That is, if the profile is to be private to you, pick a name that is least likely to collide with a name chosen by other team members.

Message.LevelOne: Profile of that name already exists
Message.LevelTwo: There is already a profile of that name. Choose a unique name for the profile.

Profiles are stored as folders in the file system, so profile names must be valid folder names for the workbench. Furthermore, they must not contain pound signs (#) or exceed 100 characters in length. Profile names are not case sensitive, but are case tolerant.
The value %1 you entered is not numeric. Enter only numeric input.

Message.LevelOne: Name not valid as folder name
Message.LevelTwo: The name must be a valid folder name within the workbench and the underlying file system.

Message.LevelOne: Name not valid as file name
Message.LevelTwo: The name must be a valid file name within the workbench and the underlying file system.
You must select a system type. The system type is the type of the operating system of the remote sytem.
You must enter a connection name. This name is arbitrary, but must be unique to the selected profile.

Message.LevelOne: Connection name is not unique for its profile
Message.LevelTwo: Connection names must be unique to the profile that contains the connection. Specify a name not already in use.
The connection name is not syntactically valid. The name must be a valid folder name within the workbench and the underlying file system.

Message.LevelOne: Enter host name or IP address
Message.LevelTwo: You must specify a host name or TCP/IP address for the remote system.
You must specify a user ID to be used to connect to the system.
The user ID entered is not syntactically valid. The only restriction for a user ID is that it not use the characters '=' or ';'.
You must specify a port number that is used to connect with the server-side communication layer.
The value you entered is not a valid port number. It must be a positive integer between 1 and 65536.
You must enter a value in the field where the cursor is.
The value you entered is already in use. Specify a value that is not already in use.
The syntax of the value at the cursor position is not valid.
You must specify a file system path.
The path you specified is already in use.
The syntax of the path you specified is not valid. Enter a file system path that is valid for the remote operating system.
You must specify your password.
Your password has expired, and must be reset before continuing.
You must specify a name for your filter pool. Filter pool names are arbitrary, but typically reflect the contents of the filters, such as "Release 1" or "Accounts Payable".

Message.LevelOne: Filter pool name already exists in this profile
Message.LevelTwo: A filter pool with this name already exists in the profile.

The filter pool name you specified is not a valid name. The name must be a valid folder name in the workbench, and must not contain the pound sign '#'. It must also not exceed 50 characters in length.
The given profile name is reserved. Specify another name for the profile.

Message.LevelOne: Connection of name %1 already exists in profile %2. Continue?
Message.LevelTwo: A connection of this name exists in another profile. While this allowed, it is discouraged as it may lead to confusion. Press Yes to create the connection, or No to cancel the creation.
You must specify a name for your filter. You can specify any name you like. Choose a name that tells others the contents of this filter. For example, "Source Files for Release 1".

Message.LevelOne: Filter name already exists in this filter pool
Message.LevelTwo: The filter name you specified is in use. You must specify a name unique for the parent filter pool.
The filter name you specified is not a valid name. The name must be a valid file name in the workbench, and must not contain the pound sign '#'. It must also not exceed 100 characters in length.
You must specify filtering information

You specified a filter string which already exists in this filter. Having duplicate filter strings will result in duplicate resources in the expanded filter. Specify unique filter strings, preferably which result in unique resources. For example, don't specify both ABC* and A*.
The filter string you specified is not syntactically correct.
You have defined the same filter string twice or more. This will result in multiple copies of the same resource, when this filter is expanded. Delete the redundant filter strings.

Message.LevelOne: Filter string '%1' already exists in filter %2
Message.LevelTwo: This filter string cannot be copied or moved to the target filter. The same filter string already exists there

Message.LevelOne: Resource will not be visible due to subsetting. Rename it anyway?
Message.LevelTwo: The new name of the resource does not match the current filter criteria. If you select Yes to rename the resource, it will not be visible within the current filter.

Message.LevelOne: Target folder cannot descend from source folder
Message.LevelTwo: It is impossible to move a folder to one of its subfolders.

Message.LevelOne: Target folder cannot be written to. Please select another destination folder.
Message.LevelTwo: The target folder is an unsuitable destination because it is read-only or you do not have write permission on it.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 on %2 can not be opened. You do not have read access to the file.
Message.LevelTwo: Change file permissions to ensure you have read access to the file.

Message.LevelOne: You do not have write access to file %1 on %2. Do you want to open the file in browse mode?
Message.LevelTwo: You do not have write permission to the file %1 on %2. You can open the file in browse (read-only) mode. If you want to edit the file, change file permissions to allow write access to the file.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 can not be saved on %2. You do not have write access to the file.
Message.LevelTwo: Change file permissions to ensure you have write access to the file.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 can not be saved on %2. You do not have write access to the file.
Message.LevelTwo: Change file permissions to ensure you have write access to the file.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 on %2 was modified since you opened this file or saved the file on the server. Do you want to replace the current contents of the file on the server?
Message.LevelTwo: The file %1 was changed on the server after it was retrieved from %2 or since the last time the file was saved on the server. Choose Yes to replace the contents of the file. Choose No to leave the file on the server with its current contents.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 was not completely saved on %2. The file was saved in the local file system.
Message.LevelTwo: An error occurred while saving the file on the server. A possible cause is the connection to the server was terminated. The file may only have been saved partially on the server. However, it was saved locally to help you recover. You will be asked to save the local copy to the server the next time you connect.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 on %2 may not have been saved completely during an earlier edit session. The file was saved on the local file system. Do you want to replace the file with the local copy now?
Message.LevelTwo: An error occurred during an earlier attempt to save the file. But a local copy of the file was saved for recovery. Choose Yes to save the local copy on the server. Choose No if recovery is not required.

Message.LevelOne: File %1 does not exist on %2. Do you want to create the file?
Message.LevelTwo: Choose Yes to create the file on the server and save the contents to the file. Choose No if you do not want the file to be created.

Message.LevelOne: You are currently editing file %1 on %2. Do you want to open the file in browse mode?
Message.LevelTwo: You are allowed to edit a file in one editor only. You can, however, open the file in another editor for browsing. Browsing lets you view the file but does not allow you to edit its contents.
